about: I'm a cybersecurity student passionate about ethical hacking, penetration testing, and securing digital infrastructure. My journey into security began with competitive CTF challenges and has evolved into hands-on research and tool development. I specialize in web application security, network penetration testing, and binary exploitation. Currently seeking opportunities to contribute to the security community while continuing to expand my knowledge in offensive security and vulnerability research.

projects.title: Automated Network Vulnerability Scanner
projects.description: Python-based automated vulnerability scanning tool that identifies misconfigurations, open ports, outdated services, and potential security flaws across network infrastructure. Features include multi-threaded scanning, custom exploit modules, and detailed reporting with remediation suggestions.

projects.title: Password Strength Analyzer & Generator
projects.description: Advanced password security tool that analyzes password entropy, checks against known breaches using haveibeenpwned API, and generates cryptographically secure passwords. Includes zxcvbn integration for realistic strength estimation.

projects.title: Web Application Security Testing Framework
projects.description: Custom-built framework for automated security testing of web applications. Focuses on OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities including SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, and authentication bypasses. Supports custom payload dictionaries and detailed vulnerability reports.

projects.title: Encrypted Communication Tool
projects.description: End-to-end encrypted messaging application using AES-256 encryption and perfect forward secrecy. Built with Python and Socket programming for secure peer-to-peer communication.

projects.title: Packet Analyzer & Network Monitor
projects.description: Real-time network traffic analyzer that captures and dissects packets, identifies suspicious patterns, and alerts on potential security threats. Features protocol analysis and export functionality.

projects.title: CTF Challenge Platform
projects.description: Designed and deployed a Jeopardy-style CTF platform for local cybersecurity community. Includes dynamic flag generation, scoreboard, and hint system.

ctf.description: Achieved top 100 ranking among 10,000+ participants. Solved 45+ challenges across cryptography, binary exploitation, reverse engineering, web exploitation, and forensics categories. Specialized in advanced binary pwn and crypto challenges.

Competed as part of a 4-member team in university CTF focusing on real-world penetration testing scenarios. Personally contributed to 8 machine compromises and full domain takeover. Led the privilege escalation efforts.

Participated in defensive security challenges focusing on digital forensics, incident response, and threat hunting. Analyzed compromised systems, identified attack vectors, and reconstructed timeline of security incidents.
Solved multiple challenges in web security and reverse engineering categories. Gained experience with advanced exploitation techniques and security research methodologies.
Competed in one of the most challenging CTFs globally. Focused on binary exploitation and reverse engineering challenges. Learned advanced techniques from top security researchers.

articles.title: Understanding SQL Injection: From Basics to Advanced Exploitation
articles.excerpt: A comprehensive deep dive into SQL injection vulnerabilities covering detection methodologies, exploitation techniques including blind SQLi and time-based attacks, and defense strategies. Includes real-world examples and lab demonstrations.

articles.title: Building Your First Cybersecurity Home Lab
articles.excerpt: Complete guide to setting up a professional-grade home security lab. Covers virtualization with VirtualBox/VMware, configuring Kali Linux, deploying vulnerable machines, network segmentation, and creating realistic attack scenarios for practice.

articles.title: Mastering OSINT: Advanced Information Gathering Techniques
articles.excerpt: Exploring advanced Open Source Intelligence techniques for reconnaissance. Covers search engine dorking, social media OSINT, metadata analysis, and automated OSINT frameworks. Essential reading for penetration testers.

articles.title: Buffer Overflow Exploitation: A Practical Guide
articles.excerpt: Hands-on tutorial for exploiting stack-based buffer overflows. Includes shellcode development, bypassing DEP/ASLR protections, and Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) techniques. Features step-by-step exploitation of vulnerable binaries.

articles.title: Web Application Penetration Testing Methodology
articles.excerpt: Professional methodology for web application security assessments. Covers reconnaissance, vulnerability identification, exploitation, and reporting. Based on OWASP Testing Guide and real penetration testing experience.

videos.title: Full Web Application Penetration Test Walkthrough
videos.description: Complete demonstration of testing a vulnerable web application from reconnaissance to post-exploitation. Covers OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities including SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, and authentication bypasses. Runtime: 25 minutes.

videos.title: Network Traffic Analysis with Wireshark
videos.description: In-depth tutorial on capturing and analyzing network packets to identify suspicious activity and potential security breaches. Includes real-world examples of detecting port scans, password sniffing, and malware communication. Runtime: 18 minutes.

videos.title: CTF Writeup: Advanced Binary Exploitation Challenge
videos.description: Step-by-step solution to a challenging CTF reverse engineering and binary exploitation problem. Demonstrates dynamic analysis, identifying vulnerabilities, and crafting exploits. Runtime: 30 minutes.
